avalancheActivity.highlights: Freeze thaw cycles recently have made the snow pack stable in most places.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has melted considerably in warm weather and rain earlier this week. Thin layer of new snow came this weekend but it rained again so the snow pack is considered stable in most places. Ongoing warm weather and snow is expected to settle even more at high eleveations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: S-A-áttir og úrkomulítið. Hiti um og yfir frostmarki til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Sluffs released in Súðavíkurhlíð and Bolungarvík on Feb 4th and 5th. Small avalanches released in Þorfinnur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has widely settled after rain over the weekend. The snow pack is likely stable in most places after freeze-thaw cycles but slabs could be present at high elevations.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It rained at high elevations on Sunday and Monday and some snow has melted in many places. Small slabs could be present at high elevations on N-NE aspects. Mainly dry in the next few days and frost at high elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar áttir næstu daga og úrkomulítið. Yfirleitt frost til fjalla en við frostmark við sjávarmál.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered generally stable after thaw and wet weather this week. Thin wind slabs could be present, mainly on northerly aspects. A hard snow surface is widespread.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snowfall and snowdrift may have formed new wind slabs on top of the stable snow especially on N-NE aspects in upper elevations. Older snow is considered stable and the snow surface is hard in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á þriðjudag og miðvikudag má búast við að kólni, ásamt hægum vindi og lítilli úrkomu.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack is considered mostly stable after freeze-thaw cycles.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Freeze-thaw cycles have made the snow isothermal and the snow pack is considered stable in most places. A thin cover of new snow arrived last Friday, followed by some rain at low elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow in most places. Small wind slabs could be present at high elevations in the northern part of the country.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar eða breytilegar áttir og dálítil él. Kólnar á þriðjudag og hiti um frostmark á láglendi.
